cyclone.name: EMILY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles WSW of Tampa Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving east across central Florida today then accelerating northeast off the east-central Florida coast and out into the western Atlantic toward the Carolinas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central west coast of Florida near Tampa Bay

weather_observation.watch_coast: Anclote River to Englewood on the west coast of Florida (includes Tampa Bay area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West-central Florida coast including Tampa Bay, then east-central Florida and portions of the southeast U.S. coastline toward North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm conditions possible with sustained winds around 35 mph and higher gusts during Monday.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 2â€“4 inches with localized amounts up to 8 inches could affect the Tampa Bay area, producing urban and low-lying flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized flash flooding of streets and low-lying terminals; brief marine squalls possible.
